info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 28 at 12:29AM CDT until March 28 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN GALVESTON AND SOUTHEASTERN CHAMBERS COUNTIES... At 1229 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Smith Point, or 13 miles southeast of Beach City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Smith Point, Gilchrist, Rollover Pass, Crystal Beach, Bolivar Peninsula, High Island and Oak Island. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
